content: elster hat | design by ann-liven esser | instagram @apurlcandream elster hat construction & sizes the elster hat is worked bottom up from the brim to the crown the hat is started with the italian cast on method and the main part of the hat is worked in a knit and purl stitch pattern towards the crown it is shaped with decreases the hat can be worked with a 40 cm 16 inches circular needle while it s best to work the crown on dpns to suit the decreasing circumference the brim will be folded in half towards the outside of the hat creating a double layer available within this pattern are two sizes m l size m fits a head circumference of 53-57 cm 21-22 4 inches size l fits a head circumference of 57-61 cm 22 4-24 inches - all instructions for size l are written in material & gauge ❖ wool 220 m 240 yards 240 m 262 5 yards of a single strand of dk weight merino yarn with a yardage of 120m / 50g 131 yards / 50g * *while choosing your yarn also look at the makers recommended needle size to be close to 3 5 mm dark red sample in size m 2 balls of lana grossa cool wool big mélange 1606 black red mottled ❖ needles 3 5 mm circular needle with a cable length of 40 cm 16 inches 3 5 mm dpns for the top of the hat ❖ gauge in the knit and purl stitch pattern of the main section 21 stitches & 27 row = 10 x 10 cm 4 inch square a cast-on using the italian cast-on method cast on 121 133 stitches st using a 3 5 mm circular knitting needle with a cable length of 40 cm 16 inches one stitch is then used to neatly join in the round after the cast on round is completed 120 132 st remain on the needle place a stitch marker at the beginning of the round b brim for both sizes work the brim in one by one ribbing until it measures 12 cm 4 75 inches or until the desired length is reached *k1 p1* repeat for the entire round --- k = knit p = purl 1 elster hat | design by ann-liven esser | instagram @apurlcandream c main section after the brim is finished start to work the main part of the hat reference and work according to the chart for your size by reading the chart from the buttom up and right to left if preferred the written instructions for the chart can be found on the next page the charted pattern of 20 22 st repeats 6 times on each round and is worked from rounds 1 45 1-51 while setting up the pattern in the first row place a stitch marker after every 20 22 st repeat for further orientation in round 31 35 start to work the decreases by purling
